response.answer_text: Are you looking for top universities? Read below the list of top 15 universities in the United Kingdom according to some of the popular university league table. Top universities in the United Kingdom: According to Times Higher Education World University Ranking 2021 - University of OxfordUniversity of CambridgeImperial College LondonUCL (University College London)London School of Economics and Political ScienceUniversity of EdinburghKing's College LondonUniversity of ManchesterUniversity of WarwickUniversity of BristolUniversity of GlasgowUniversity of BirminghamQueen Mary University of LondonUniversity of SheffieldUniversity of SouthamptonAccording to QS World University Ranking 2021 - University of OxfordUniversity of CambridgeImperial College LondonUCL (University College London)University of EdinburghUniversity of ManchesterKing's College LondonLondon School of Economics and Political ScienceUniversity of BristolUniversity of WarwickUniversity of GlasgowDurham UniversityUniversity of BirminghamUniversity of SouthamptonUniversity of LeedsAccording to Complete University Guide University Ranking 2021 - University of CambridgeUniversity of OxfordUniversity of St AndrewsLondon School of Economics and Political ScienceImperial College LondonLoughborough UniversityDurham UniversityLancaster UniversityUniversity of BathUCL (University College London)University of WarwickUniversity of ExeterUniversity of BirminghamUniversity of BristolUniversity of EdinburghThese are some of the leading universities to study in the United Kingdom.

Well, I would say that it depends on the subject you are interested to study, but based on the last REF and TEF classifications, they are:University of Oxford, Cambridge, Imperial, UCL, Edinburgh, King’s College, Manchester, Warwick, Bristol, Durham, Birmingham, Glasgow, Nottingham, Sheffield and Leeds. Those are part of the Russell Group. However, they are more researched focused (in general) and the business or practitioner perspective can be left aside. Now, there are other schools for specific topics such as LSE, LBS, St. Andrews and Cranfield. At the end, it depends on what you are looking forward to study and practice.
